FuncDef:
The multicast invalid-packet igmp command sets the maximum number of invalid igmp packets that can be stored on a device.
The undo multicast invalid-packet igmp command deletes the set maximum number of invalid igmp packets that can be stored on a device. The multicast invalid-packet igmp command sets the maximum number of invalid igmp packets that can be stored on a device. The undo multicast invalid-packet igmp command deletes the set maximum number of invalid igmp packets that can be stored on a device. By default, a device can save a maximum of 10 invalid packets for IGMP protocol.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the maximum number of invalid multicast protocol packets that can be stored on a device. max-number specifies the maximum number of invalid multicast protocol packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100.
